title: U.S. per capita consumption of dried fruit 2000 to 2019
summary: Overall Per capita consumption in pounds has decreased over the Year.

Per capita consumption in pounds is roughly constant from 2006/07 to 2012/13, roughly decreasing from 2012/13 to 2013/14, roughly increasing from 2013/14 to 2014/15, roughly constant from 2014/15 to 2017/18, and lastly rapidly decreasing from 2017/18 to 2018/19.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2017/18 and 2018/19.
Maximum Per capita consumption in pounds, about 2.44 was reported at Year 2013/14
Minimum Per capita consumption in pounds about 1.0 was reached at Year 2018/19
